message.content: This question requires some basic knowledge about raccoon behavior and their attraction to food sources. Raccoons are attracted to areas where they can find easily accessible food. Leaving lids off garbage cans would provide an open food source for them, increasing the likelihood of them hanging out nearby. Option (A) is incorrect because shooting raccoons would likely scare them away. Option (B) is not related to raccoon behavior or food sources. Option (D) is also incorrect because putting garbage cans inside the garage would remove the easily accessible food source for raccoons, therefore reducing the likelihood of them hanging out nearby.

This question requires reasoning and critical thinking. Raccoons are attracted to places where they can find food easily. Leaving lids off garbage cans would provide easier access for raccoons to scavenge for food, increasing the likelihood of them hanging out nearby. Option (A) is incorrect because shooting raccoons would likely cause them to stay away. Option (B) is unrelated to raccoon behavior. Option (D) would reduce the chances of raccoons finding food in garbage cans, so it would not cause them to hang out nearby.

Leaving lids off garbage cans would provide an easy opportunity for raccoons to scavenge for food, so it is likely to attract more raccoons to hang out nearby. Option (A) is incorrect because shooting raccoons would actually scare them away. Option (B) is unrelated to raccoons' behavior and unlikely to have an effect on their presence. Option (D) would prevent raccoons from accessing the garbage cans, so it would not attract them to hang out nearby.

Option (D) is also incorrect because putting garbage cans inside the garage would eliminate the easy access to food for raccoons.
